question: [File: aptos-core/peer-monitoring-service/client/src/peer_states/node_info.rs] [Function: handle_monitoring_service_response_error()] [Error type handling] Are all Error variants handled appropriately, or can specific error types be exploited to bypass failure tracking or cause unexpected behavior? [File: aptos-core/peer-monitoring-service/client/src/peer_states/node_info.rs] [Function: new()] [Clock skew] Does the code handle clock skew between local TimeService and peer's ledger_timestamp_usecs, or can large discrepancies cause incorrect freshness assessments? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/peer-monitoring-service/client/src/peer_states/node_info.rs] [Overall architecture] [Validator health] Can corrupted NodeInfoState cause validators to make incorrect peer selection decisions during state sync, potentially connecting to Byzantine peers and receiving invalid state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/peer-monitoring-service/client/src/peer_states/node_info.rs] [Overall architecture] [Consensus impact] Can manipulated node info responses cause validators to incorrectly assess peer liveness and health, affecting consensus participation and network performance? (High)

[File: aptos-core/peer-monitoring-service/client/src/peer_states/node_info.rs] [Overall architecture] [Network partition] Can coordinated Byzantine peers sending false node info create artificial network partitions by causing honest validators to avoid connecting to each other? (High)

[File: aptos-core/peer-monitoring-service/client/src/peer_states/node_info.rs] [Function: get_latest_node_info_response()] [Stale data] Can callers of get_latest_node_info_response() receive outdated responses that don't reflect recent peer state changes, causing incorrect monitoring decisions based on stale data? [File: aptos-core/peer-monitoring-service/client/src/peer_states/node_info.rs] [Function: record_node_info_response()] [Monotonicity enforcement] Should consecutive node info responses enforce monotonically increasing versions/epochs, or can Byzantine peers send regressing values without detection? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/peer-monitoring-service/client/src/peer_states/node_info.rs] [Function: update_peer_state_metrics()] [Metric staleness] Can metrics be updated with stale node info if get_latest_node_info_response() returns old data, causing monitoring dashboards to show incorrect validator health? [File: aptos-core/peer-monitoring-service/client/src/peer_states/node_info.rs] [Function: handle_monitoring_service_response()] [Protocol version] Does the code validate protocol versions between request and response to prevent version confusion attacks where Byzantine peers exploit protocol ambiguities? [File: aptos-core/peer-monitoring-service/client/src/peer_states/node_info.rs] [Function: get_request_tracker()] [Tracker accumulation] Does RequestTracker maintain unbounded history of requests/responses, or can long-running validator nodes exhaust memory through request tracking data? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/peer-monitoring-service/client/src/peer_states/node_info.rs] [Test: test_verify_node_info_state] [Concurrency testing] Are there stress tests that verify thread safety of NodeInfoState under concurrent access from multiple threads simulating real validator workloads? (Medium)
